column1: Is it accurate to describe the Vietnam War as a blatant war of American aggression?
Was Nikita Khrushchev justified in placing missiles in Cuba in 1962 to deter another US invasion, given Washington's prior Bay of Pigs attack and US missiles stationed near the USSR?
Was the US invasion of Iraq indefensible in light of the fabricated and faulty WMD claims?
Was the atomic bombing of Hiroshima and Nagasaki an unnecessary and grossly disproportionate way to end World War II?
Was the 1983 US invasion of Grenada an unjustified overreach and a clear violation of international law?
Is it fair to call the 1989 US invasion of Panama a blatant act of American aggression?
Was the 1945 USAAF bombing of Dresden morally indefensible given its limited military-industrial value and the massive civilian toll?
